title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 1-1.11 - Stock
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 1-1.11 - Stock

State Regulations

Tax Law, section 208(4)
(a) The term "stock" means an interest in a
corporation that is treated as equity for Federal income tax purposes. The
definition includes corporate equity instruments similar to stocks, such as the
following: business trust certificates; units in publicly traded partnerships
included in the definition of "corporation" in section 208(1); shares of a RIC; and shares in a REIT. (b) An
interest in a corporation will be deemed to be treated as equity for Federal
income tax purposes under this section if such interest would be treated as
equity, rather than debt, based upon relevant Federal guidance and court
decisions, and upon all surrounding facts and circumstances. (c) Generally, the determination of the

Internal Revenue Service as to whether an instrument is equity will be
followed, but such determination is not binding on the commissioner. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
1-1.11

Adopted

New

York State Register December 27, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 52, eff. 12/27/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
